title.narrative: DEMAND OF SERVICES AND CONTINUUM OF CARE

description.narrative: By 2020, children, adolescents and their families have the knowledge and ability required to seek HIV prevention, care and treatment services and remain in the continuum of care in UNICEF-supported districts, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age children, particularly girls and those in vulnerable regions, have access to quality basic education, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, children, adolescents and their families have the knowledge and ability required to seek HIV prevention, care andtreatment services and remain in the continuum of care in UNICEF-supported districts

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the combination of HIV prevention among youths and adolescents; Our innovation was the U-Report scaling-up with the SMS platform and the toll-free line offering information on issues affecting adolescents and youths, including but not limited to reproductive health, birth registration, gender-based violence, COVID-19.UNICEF initiated and supported the Youth 3+1 Initiative promoting integrated and collaborative delivery of sexual and reproductive health services, HIV and COVID-19 prevention around the health district, the community, school and social media platforms.Over the cycle, 300,915 persons were registered on the online platform, and 46,178 online calls were addressed in 2021. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
